New Records: Jackson Chourio became the second-youngest player in postseason history with a multi-homer game.
Jackson Chourio is the second player in AL/NL history to hit two game-tying homers in the same postseason game.
Jackson Chourio became the second rookie with multiple game-tying or go-ahead homers in a postseason game.
Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio homered twice for the Brewers, tying the game both times.
Garrett Mitchell hit a go-ahead home run in the eighth inning.
The Brewers came back from two separate deficits to win the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Pat Murphy emphasized the importance of contributors and the team's resilience.
Manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the importance of putting pressure on the bases and taking extra bases when needed.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Pat Murphy expressed pride in the team's ability to fight and come back from deficits.
Manager Carlos Mendoza acknowledged the Mets' missed opportunities to blow the game open.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went to a winner-take-all third game in the NL Wild Card Series.
The Mets left nine men on base, seven in scoring position.
This was the second Wild Card Series to go to a third game since the current best-of-three format became permanent in 2022.
